website_summaries.verdict: Extremely tough and well-designed men’s lacrosse stick that will give experienced players the performance they need.
pros: This lacrosse stick is made with a controllable level of flex to ensure the player has all of the power required
Regardless of the player’s hand positioning on the stick, the majority of the energy will be transferred to the ball with the built-in flex technology
Shaft uses carbon fiber materials, which help the stick retain firmness when needed for ball control
cons: Price is higher than some other sticks
May break when placed under extreme pressure of a rough game

customer_reviews.title: The whole stick
customer_reviews.text: What do I say? My 13 year old son used this stick for his first game today and he did awesome with the stick! He said the flex and the movement and the weight was unbelievable to use. He has the matching head that goes with this stick and that for sure made a difference in his accuracy. He said he can’t even imagine having anything else other than this. Don’t hesitate to buy this for yourself or your son.. well worth the money. My son has at least 10 wooden sticks and breaks those like nothing but the dragonfly held up with flying colors.
customer_reviews.author: Trent

customer_reviews.title: Great shaft. Be careful of head fit.
customer_reviews.text: Great shaft. Super light. Just be careful what head you want to attach due to ergonomic dimensions. My 6th grade son loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke immediately -- Not helpful with return......referred to manufacturer
customer_reviews.text: Bought a lacrosse stick....cracked and broke within the month....contacted seller and instead of making good on it.....told me to contact the manufacturer.....they also sold me the head for that stick....it broke on first use.....they did refund and sell another without any problems....but these are name brand pieces of equipment that shouldn't break within the first month of use. Very disappointed to be pushed off to have to find the manufacturer instead of making an exchange.
customer_reviews.author: The Doc

customer_reviews.title: Hesitate to buy it again
customer_reviews.text: The shaft is light but cracked after one hit which I imagine is abnormal. I sent an email twice to amazon about the ability to return the item however never received a response.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Easily breaks
customer_reviews.text: My son broke this stick during a game. It was under warranty, so we received a replacement stick. Unfortunately it broke during one of his practices. It only lasted 5 months and not even during the busy season.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: INVERTED!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the e30 shaft. The whole stick is 180 degrees out if how it should be (hole and graphics are on the wrong way). The skinny side of the shaft is supposed to be on the back of the stick, not the front! Very disappointed and will be returning. The second picture is a screen grab from a video online of how is should be.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great lacrosse shaft
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on time and in perfect condition. Had to add some tape to get a secure fit with the head of choice but it is solid. Incredibly light and grippy.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Cracked
customer_reviews.text: My sons stick cracked over the past weekend has anyone else had this issue?
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good stick so far. Light weight and good grip per my child.
customer_reviews.author: autonfour

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was satisfactory but the week of practice the head (basket) flew off when it was used.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara M McConnell

customer_reviews.title: Major durability issues.
customer_reviews.text: First off, my son is on his 3rd Epoch Dragonfly in less than a year. The first one broke in the spring season and the 2nd in the fall. While they have replaced both under the one year warranty I was told they would not be replacing anymore. Frankly, it’s not a great stick and lacks the durability required for aggressive lax players. My son has not even put his head back on the new one and has elected to go with his back up stick because it’s trustworthy.
customer_reviews.author: Stacie R.

product_meta.title: Epoch Lacrosse Dragonfly Eight 30" Attack Lacrosse Shaft
feature_bullets: Our exclusive Surface Veil Technology is engineered to increase the overall toughness of the Dragonfly Eight
Our proprietary 12K Intelligent Weave Technology is designed to stabilize the hands and push energy towards the head of the stick when passing or shooting
Uniform Release provides a consistent flex profile throughout the top 2/3 of the shaft regardless of a player’s hand positioning

We achieve flex by manipulating the orientation of the carbon fiber. Our shaft’s bend when you need it to, but retains its firmness for maximum control. Conventional shafts that tout flex often use fiberglass, a cheaper, less durable material, to increase the bendability

Intelligent Weave allows for a more uniform construction as the carbon filaments in each tow (row) are spread out creating a thinner and more closed woven fabric providing reduced weight, optimal mechanicals and minimal voids in the composite layup. By reducing “Crimp” (when carbon fiber runs in a uniform direction(s) that is not structurally beneficial) we can decrease weight by reducing non-essential material while maintaining the structural integrity required by lacrosse
